skill.name: creating-skills
skill.description: Use when creating new skills, documenting workflows, or standardizing processes into reusable skill definitions.
skill.summary: Use when creating new skills, documenting workflows, or standardizing processes into reusable skill ...
skill.author: BPSAI

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no environment variable access, and no command execution. Contains only templates and conventions for creating AI skills.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle to capture and share best practices across sessions. This skill provides templates, conventions, and validation tools for creating standardized skills that document workflows and prevent repeated errors.
actual_capabilities: Provides SKILL.md template with required frontmatter format
Defines naming conventions for consistent skill naming
Lists validation rules for skill quality assurance
Includes CLI commands for skill listing and validation
Documents anti-patterns to avoid in skill creation
Explains directory structure for multi-file skills
limitations: Does not execute or generate skill files automatically
Does not access or modify the filesystem
Does not provide skill implementation code
Does not integrate with external services

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflows
use_cases.description: Create documented skills that capture best practices and ensure consistent execution across all team members.

use_cases.title: Document Deployment Processes
use_cases.description: Transform complex deployment procedures into reusable skills that prevent configuration errors and ensure repeatability.

use_cases.title: Onboard New Team Members
use_cases.description: Build skills that encode project-specific procedures, reducing onboarding time and knowledge gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use-case].

prompt_templates.title: Add Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill SKILL.md against the validation checklist and suggest fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Structure Multi-file Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me structure a skill with reference documentation and scripts directory.

prompt_templates.title: Convert Workflow to Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me convert this multi-step workflow into a properly structured skill definition.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for handling git merge conflicts
output: SKILL.md template applied with gerund naming convention
Validation passed: name matches directory, description under 1024 chars
Add your steps: detect conflict, review files, resolve, commit, verify

best_practices: Use third-person voice in descriptions (e.g., 'Manages X' not 'Use when you need X')
Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines by extracting details to reference documents
Validate skills with `bpsai-pair skill validate` before deployment
anti_patterns: Documenting knowledge Claude already has (like git basics or Python syntax)
Adding extra metadata fields (version, author, tags) in frontmatter
Using underscores instead of hyphens in skill names

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidance only.

faq.question: What is the maximum skill description length?
faq.answer: Keep descriptions under 1024 characters using third-person voice without 'you'.

faq.question: Can this skill create files automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides templates and guidance. Users create files manually or with other tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a read-only documentation skill. It reads no files and sends no data anywhere.

faq.question: How do I validate my skill?
faq.answer: Run `bpsai-pair skill validate [skill-name]` to check naming, structure, and frontmatter rules.

faq.question: How is this different from regular documentation?
faq.answer: Skills are structured specifically for AI consumption with frontmatter, triggers, and actionable steps.
